intro: Scabiosa rhodopensis, commonly known as the Balkan scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in meadows and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. Scabiosa rhodopensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
